attributes.action: increase sentencing and fines for those who provide a 'Not Guilty' plea only to change that to a 'Guilty' plea on the day of the trial without any further evidence being offered.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is a well known practice for defence solicitors to advise their clients to submit a 'Not Guilty' plea at an initial hearing. This eventually results in a trial date being set. On the day of the trial the plea is changed to 'Guilty'.

This practice exists as the defence hope that a witness may fail to show up at court (or similar) and the case will be dismissed on a technicality. It can also provide extra work for defence solicitors.

The defendant knows they are guilty from the beginning and could enter that plea at the first hearing. The result of this practice is the wasting of court time and thousands of pounds of public money on court costs, witness care, police and all other bodies associated with the justice system. More importantly it needlessly extends the agony for the victims and witnesses in the case.

If no further evidence is offered between the initial hearing and the day of the trial, yet the plea inexplicably changes a far harsher penalty could be handed out.

Consideration could also be given to removing or reclaiming legal aid funding to defence solicitors in the same circumstances to prevent them advising their clients to indulge in this practice.
